affecteddate.title: Affected Date
affecteddate.remarks: Date when user was affected by issue. Enter a date or click the Select Date button and select a date.

pluspcustcurrencytotal.title: Customer Total
pluspcustcurrencytotal.remarks: The pre-tax total in the currency that the customer uses to pay the bill. This value is calculated by multiplying the pre-tax total by the specified exchange rate.

pelappr2.title: Higher Approval for Mandate
pelappr2.remarks: The higher approval person group for mandate approval requests

pelappr1.title: Lower Approval for Mandate
pelappr1.remarks: The lower approval person group for mandate approval requests

externalrecid.title: External Record
externalrecid.remarks: Ticket ID for any Ticket external to MAXIMO

ownergroup.title: Owner Group
ownergroup.remarks: Owner group of the service request. This group has overall responsibility for the service request. You can enter a value either in this field or the Owner field. Use the Select Action menu to assign an owner group. Note: this action may not be available to all users.

calcshift.title: Shift
calcshift.remarks: Along with the calculation calendar, sets the business hours that calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Select Value button to choose a shift.

plusprevnum.title: Agreement Revision Number
plusprevnum.remarks: Revision number of the customer agreement.

reportedbyname.title: Name
reportedbyname.remarks: Name of person making the service request. Enter a value or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value.

pelcarstdate.title: Cust Appr Date
pelcarstdate.remarks: Customer approval request status Update date

reportedpriority.title: Reported Priority
reportedpriority.remarks: Priority of service request as determined by person making the request.

pluspcustponum.title: Customer PO Number
pluspcustponum.remarks: Identifier of the customer purchase order that authorizes this work.

impact.title: Impact
impact.remarks: The Business Impact/severity of the Ticket

m2sms_inc_ld.title: Include Long Description in Long Description
m2sms_inc_ld.remarks: Include Long Description in Long Description

parent.title: Parent
parent.remarks: The parent customer of the customer. Parent customers are not required. The parent must be an existing customer, and cannot be the current customer or a child of another customer.

currencycode.title: Customer Currency
currencycode.remarks: The currency that is specified for the customer.

peltravelnot.title: Notify Customer Travel
peltravelnot.remarks: A flag to indicate that the customer should get a notification when the engineer travels to site

pelcusthdemail.title: Help Desk Escalation Email
pelcusthdemail.remarks: Help Desk Contact email for escalation

changeby.title: Change By
changeby.remarks: The Person who updated the Status

changedate.title: Date of Status Change
changedate.remarks: The date the Status was changed

pelinternal.title: Internal Company
pelinternal.remarks: Flag to indicate it is an internal Company

pelcusthdphone.title: Help Desk Escalation Number
pelcusthdphone.remarks: Help Desk Contact phone number for escalation

pelpomand.title: Customer PO Required
pelpomand.remarks: A flag to indicate that a PO number is mandatory for this customer

name.title: Name
name.remarks: Name of the customer. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

duns.title: DUNS #
duns.remarks: The customer's Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) number, for reference purposes only.

customer.title: Customer
customer.remarks: The customer number or identifier. When you create a customer, you type a value here. This value is used to distinguish between multiple customers, so it must be unique. You cannot change this value after you save a customer record.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: The status of the customer. When you create and save a new customer, the status is Inactive. The customer status must be changed to Active before the customer can be used. The customer cannot be made Inactive if there is an approved customer agreement for the customer, if any associated customers are Active, or if it is the parent customer of an active customer. A customer cannot be Inactive if the customer has a parent that is Active.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: Status of the service request. If you are not viewing the Change Status dialog box, click the Change Status button in the toolbar to change the status. Note: this action may not be available to all users. Default statuses are NEW, QUEUED, PENDING, INPRG, RESOLVED, and CLOSED. See the online Help for more information on statuses.

pelreportashs.title: Customer HS Risk
pelreportashs.remarks: Reported by customer as presenting a Health and Safety Risk

commodity.title: Service
commodity.remarks: Service provided or purchased. Enter a value or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value.

pelappr1limit.title: Threshold for Second Level Appr
pelappr1limit.remarks: The threshold where the second level of approver is also required

affectedphonenp.title: Affected Phone NP
affectedphonenp.remarks: Telephone number of person affected by the issue from e-mail listener. (Non Persistent)

commoditygroup.title: Service Group
commoditygroup.remarks: Identifies the group providing the service. Enter a value or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value.

inheritstatus.title: Inherit Status Changes
inheritstatus.remarks: Inherit status from follow up record

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Description for Class Structure

description.title: Description
description.remarks: Describes the selected asset class structure.

pelcommoditygroup.title: Service Group
pelcommoditygroup.remarks: The service group associated with the classification

pelcommodity.title: Service
pelcommodity.remarks: The service associated with the classification

type.title: Type
type.remarks: Defines the type of the node. Common uses would be Solution Content, Asset Classifications, FAQ, etc.

pluspcustomer.title: Customer
pluspcustomer.remarks: The customer associated with the classification. This field is editable only when the Is Global check box is cleared. Click Show/Manage Customers next to the Customer field to associate customers with the classification.  If more than one customer is associated with the classification, the field is read-only, and you can modify the customer relationship by clicking Show/Manage Customers.

pelinternalpriority.title: Default Priority
pelinternalpriority.remarks: The default priority for the Classification

pelchildquestion.title: Child Questions
pelchildquestion.remarks: The question that guides a user to the child classifications

peldiagnosisadvice.title: Diagnostic Advice
peldiagnosisadvice.remarks: Diagnosis advice for use with the creation of Service Requests

description_class.title: Class Description
description_class.remarks: Description of the classification specified for this record

parentclassificationid.title: Parent Classification
parentclassificationid.remarks: The parent classificationid of the classstructure

pelisdiagnosis.title: Diagnostic Tool
pelisdiagnosis.remarks: Flag to state if the classification is associated with the diagnostic tool

reportedby.title: Reported By
reportedby.remarks: Identifies person making the service request. Enter a value or click the Select Value button.

pellocbuilding.title: Building
pellocbuilding.remarks: The Location ID of the building level ancestor of the SR Location

origrecorgid.title: Originating Record Oganization
origrecorgid.remarks: Organization Identifier of the originating Record

assetnum.title: Asset
assetnum.remarks: Identifies the primary asset on the service request. If the service request is for an asset, enter its identifier in the Asset field or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value. The Select Value dialog box, by default, displays all assets where the person ID in the Affected Person field is associated with an asset as either an asset user or an asset custodian. If the Asset Site field contains a value before you use the Select Value dialog box, the list of assets is always filtered by that value. After you select an asset, Maximo copies the asset location to the Location field. You can enter related assets and/or locations in the Related Assets table window. NOTE: These actions may not be available to all users.

assetsiteid.title: Asset Site
assetsiteid.remarks: Site of the asset on the service request. The default value is the site of the person record in the Affected User field. Enter a value or click the Select Value button. If the Asset Site field contains a value before you access the Select Value dialog box on the Asset or Location field, the list of assets or locations is always filtered by this value. You cannot edit this field after you have associated assets or locations with a record; you must remove the associations before you can edit this field.

pelreportascrit.title: Customer Business Critical
pelreportascrit.remarks: Reported by the customer as Business Critical

pelinfosrreason.title: Reason Code for Information
pelinfosrreason.remarks: The reason code for Information Service Requests

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long description of the service request. To check spelling of text you enter, click the Long Description button next to the Summary field.

actualfinish.title: Actual Finish
actualfinish.remarks: Actual finish date. Enter a date or click the Select Date button and select a date.

country.title: Country
country.remarks: The country of the service address.

latitudey.title: Latitude(Y)
latitudey.remarks: The measurement, in degrees, that the service address is north or south of the equator. Latitude is used with longitude to locate a place on a map. You must specify latitude in decimal degrees.

pelviaaddress.title: En-route Stop
pelviaaddress.remarks: A service address that is used as a 'stop' en-route to this Service Address

city.title: City
city.remarks: The city of the service address.

county.title: County
county.remarks: The county of the service address.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: The description of the service address.

formattedaddress.title: Formatted Address
formattedaddress.remarks: This address is formatted according to the map provider's requirements and is updated when a location is found on the map tab. You can use the formatted address to search for addresses on the map tab.

postalcode.title: Zip/Postal Code
postalcode.remarks: The postal code of the service address.

regiondistrict.title: Region/District
regiondistrict.remarks: The region or district of the service address.

geocode.title: GEO Code
geocode.remarks: GEO code for calculation of sales tax.

longitudex.title: Longitude(X)
longitudex.remarks: The measurement, in degrees, that the service address is east or west of the prime meridian. Longitude is used with latitude to locate a place on a map. You must specify longitude in decimal degrees.

pelviadesc.title: En-route Stop Description
pelviadesc.remarks: A description of the via address (e.g. Key Pickup, Ferry Terminal)

affectedpersonnp.title: Affected User (Non Persistent)
affectedpersonnp.remarks: Identifies person affected by the issue. From Email Listener. (Non Persistent)

pluspmaxprice.title: Notify if Price Exceeds
pluspmaxprice.remarks: Maximum price that you can charge for this work.  You must notify customer if the price will exceed this amount.

internalpriority.title: Internal Priority
internalpriority.remarks: Priority of the service request as determined by the service desk agent.

origwoid.title: Originating WO
origwoid.remarks: Trigger field for cross over domain.

plusppricesched.title: Agreement Price Schedule
plusppricesched.remarks: Identifies the price schedule that applies to this service request.

origrecordid.title: Originating Record
origrecordid.remarks: Ticket/WO ID that spawned or created one or more other tickets or work orders

affectedpersonid.title: Affected Person
affectedpersonid.remarks: Identifies person affected by the issue. Enter a value or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value.

actualstart.title: Actual Start
actualstart.remarks: Actual start date. Enter a date or click the Select Date button and select a date.

siteid.title: Site
siteid.remarks: Unique identifier of the site. Enter a value or click the Select Value button.

affectedperson.title: Affected User
affectedperson.remarks: Identifies person affected by the issue. Enter a value or click the Select Value button.

affectedphone.title: Phone
affectedphone.remarks: Telephone number of person affected by the issue.

origtkid.title: Originating Ticket
origtkid.remarks: non-persistent attribute that triggers copying of crossover attributes.

firstname.title: First Name
firstname.remarks: The first name of the person whose record this is.

pelwcsettings.title: Work Centre Search Settings
pelwcsettings.remarks: The Contact Centre Work Centre Search Settings

pluspcustvndname.title: Name
pluspcustvndname.remarks: Describes the customer or vendor name.

title.title: Title
title.remarks: The job title of this person.

pcardnum.title: Card #
pcardnum.remarks: Identifies the number of this person's company credit card.

pcardverification.title: Verification Value
pcardverification.remarks: The three- or four-digit code at the end of the credit card number. You can find this verification code on the back or front of the card.

personid.title: Person
personid.remarks: Identifier of the person's record. This value must be unique. When you save the record, this field becomes read only.

pluspcustvendor.title: Customer/Vendor
pluspcustvendor.remarks: The company that employs this person. If the person is an employee of a customer, select the customer identifier. If the person is an employee of a vendor, select the vendor identifier.  You can place this person in a security group that will restrict his or her security access so that he or she only can see information related to this customer.  If you are changing the size of the COMPANIES.COMPANY field or the PLUSPCUSTOMER.CUSTOMER field, set the size of this field to the maximum width of those two fields.

locationsite.title: Person's Site
locationsite.remarks: The site where this person is located.

pcardexpdate.title: Expiration Date
pcardexpdate.remarks: The expiration date of the company credit card.

orgid.title: Organization
orgid.remarks: The organization identifier that is assigned to this service address.

lastname.title: Last Name
lastname.remarks: The last name of the person whose record this is.

statusdate.title: Status Date
statusdate.remarks: The date of the last status change.

saddresscode.title: Service Address
saddresscode.remarks: The address code identifies a service address. It must be unique by site for each service address.

displayname.title: Name
displayname.remarks: A nickname or familiar name that this person can be identified by. This field is automatically populated when values are entered in the First Name and/or Last Name fields. You can change the default information.

pelbusunit.title: Business Unit
pelbusunit.remarks: This is the Value as per the Metadata table where the Metagroup is set to Business Unit

location.title: Person's Location
location.remarks: The place where this person is located.

pluspcustvndtype.title: Cust/Vendor Type
pluspcustvndtype.remarks: The value displayed in this field indicates whether the company that employs the person is a customer or a vendor.  If the Customer/Vendor field is blank, the value INTERNAL is displayed, indicating that this person is an internal employee of the service provider.

pcardtype.title: Card Type
pcardtype.remarks: The type of credit card used. Enter a value or click Select Value.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: The current status of the person. On inserting a new record, this field defaults to an active status.

affectedusername.title: Name
affectedusername.remarks: Name of person affected by the issue. Enter a value or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value.

reportedemail.title: E-mail
reportedemail.remarks: E-mail address of person making the service request.

calccalendar.title: Calendar
calccalendar.remarks: Business days and times used to calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Detail Menu to select a calendar or go to the Calendars application to create one.

reportdate.title: Reported Date
reportdate.remarks: Date when the service request was made. Enter a date or click the Select Date button.

origrecsiteid.title: Originating Record Site
origrecsiteid.remarks: Site Identifier of the originating Record

description.title: Summary
description.remarks: Describes the service request. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button. Additonal text that you enter appears in the Details field.

reportedphone.title: Phone
reportedphone.remarks: Telephone number of person making the service request.

owner.title: Owner
owner.remarks: Owner of the service request. This person has overall responsibility for the service request. You can enter a value either in this field or the Owner Group field. Use the Select Action menu to assign an owner. Note: this action may not be available to all users.

calcorgid.title: Organization
calcorgid.remarks: Organization associated with the calculation calendar, and used with the Calendar and Shift fields to calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Detail Menu button to select an organization or go to the Organizations application to create one.

affectedemail.title: E-mail
affectedemail.remarks: E-mail address of person affected by the issue.

relatedrecclass.title: Class
relatedrecclass.remarks: Class of the related ticket. Maximo enters this value for the related ticket you select. You can choose a ticket class before choosing a related ticket; if you do so, Maximo displays only tickets of the chosen class in the Select Value dialog box for the related ticket. To choose a ticket class, enter a value or click the Select Value button.

relatedrecwonum.title: Work Order
relatedrecwonum.remarks: Identifies the related work order. Click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value.

relatetype.title: Relationship
relatetype.remarks: Describes the relationship of this record to the record in the key field.

relatedreckey.title: Related Record Key
relatedreckey.remarks: Identifies the related ticket. Enter a value or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value.

unitcost.title: Unit Cost
unitcost.remarks: Item Unit Cost when work order was approved

pelupliftstatus.title: Uplift Status
pelupliftstatus.remarks: The status of the uplift request

linetype.title: Line Type
linetype.remarks: Line type. The value of line type could be Item, Material, Service, Special Order or External Catalog Item.

pelhireoffactualdate.title: Actual Plant Hire Date
pelhireoffactualdate.remarks: The date the plant was actually off hired

pelpo.title: Planned Material Type
pelpo.remarks: Purchase Order on which this direct issue item is ordered

pelhireoffref.title: Hiring Ref Nr
pelhireoffref.remarks: The reference number for off hiring

pelupliftdate.title: Uplift Date
pelupliftdate.remarks: The date the uplift request was made

pelhireoffplanneddate.title: Sched Plant Hire Date
pelhireoffplanneddate.remarks: The planned date to off hire the plant

unitcost.title: Unit Cost
unitcost.remarks: Cost per unit of the item. If entering a service line item, you can enter a unit cost here and a number of hours in the Quantity field. Or, you can enter a lump sum amount in the Line Cost field. If you specified a currency code in the Currency field on the PO tab, the unit cost is expressed in that currency.

receiptscomplete.title: Receipts Complete
receiptscomplete.remarks: Specifies whether all receipts for this line are complete. The check box is read only. The check box is selected if the Receipts field on the PO tab is COMPLETE, or if the Receipts field is PARTIAL and the Quantity Received amount is greater than or equal to the value in the Quantity field. The box is cleared if the Receipts field is NONE, or if the Receipts field is PARTIAL and the Quantity Received amount is less that the value in the Quantity field.

linetype.title: Line Type
linetype.remarks: Line type. Possible values include Item, Material, Service, Special Order, or External Catalog Item.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: Describes the PO line item. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

remark.title: Remarks
remark.remarks: Comment about the item. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button. All information in the Remarks field is on the record Maximo sends to e-commerce enabled vendors. You can use this field to provide additional information to the vendor when you send the purchase order via the Internet.

gldebitacct.title: GL Debit Account
gldebitacct.remarks: Account code for the general ledger account that will be charged the cost of the line item. If you are entering a service line item, you must populate either this field or the Work Order, WO Task ID, Location, or Asset field.

receipttolamt.title: Receipt Tolerance Amount
receipttolamt.remarks: The amount of items that can be received over the amount set in the initial agreement.

pcardnum.title: Procurement Card #
pcardnum.remarks: Procurement Card Number Crosses over from MRLINE.PCARDNUM or PRLINE.PCARDNUM

requestedby.title: Requested By
requestedby.remarks: Person who asked for the item. You can set a default value in the Default Table Data area.

receivedqty.title: Quantity Received
receivedqty.remarks: Number of order units received for the line item.

receipttolerance.title: Receipt Tolerance %
receipttolerance.remarks: The percentage value of items that can be received over the amount set in the initial agreement.

pelassignmentid.title: Assignment ID
pelassignmentid.remarks: Assignment ID from the WO Referenced on the PO Line

refwo.title: Work Order
refwo.remarks: Identifies the work order referenced on the PO.

shipto.title: Ship To
shipto.remarks: Address code where the item will be shipped.

linecost.title: Line Cost
linecost.remarks: Cost for the line item, calculated by multiplying the quantity by the unit cost. If you are entering a cost for a service line item, you can enter a lump sum amount in this field (rather than specify a quantity of hours and a unit cost).

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Long Description For PO Line Item

enterdate.title: Entered Date
enterdate.remarks: Date and time the line item was entered. The default is the system date and time.

receivedtotalcost.title: Received Line Cost
receivedtotalcost.remarks: Actual total cost of the received line item.

revstatus.title: Revision Status
revstatus.remarks: Shows when a line item has been added to a purchase order, or when a line item on a purchase order has been modified.

glcreditacct.title: GL Credit Account
glcreditacct.remarks: Account code for the general ledger account that will be credited the cost of the line item.

orderunit.title: Order Unit
orderunit.remarks: Standard unit by which the item is ordered, such as roll or case. After you enter a value, Maximo enters the corresponding conversion value in the Conversion field. If you are ordering a service, you can enter hours in this field. If you are ordering materials not in inventory, you can enter a new or existing unit in this field, or leave this field blank.

revisionnum.title: Revision
revisionnum.remarks: Revision number of the purchase order. Indicates how many times a purchase order has been revised.

pcardexpdate.title: Procurement Card Expiration
pcardexpdate.remarks: Procurement Card Expiration Crosses over from MRLINE.PCARDEXPDATE or PRLINE.PCARDEXPDATE

polinenum.title: Line
polinenum.remarks: Line tem number. If you do not enter a number, Maximo generates one automatically. The line item number is unique for this PO.

remark_longdescription.title: Remark Long Description
remark_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Description for PO Line Item.

enterby.title: Entered By
enterby.remarks: The person who first entered the line item. The default is the current login ID.

shiptoattn.title: Attention
shiptoattn.remarks: Person to whom the item is being shipped.

orderqty.title: Quantity
orderqty.remarks: Number of units of the ordered item. If the PO was created from a PR or RFQ, the default is the quantity on the PR or RFQ. If the PO was not created from another record, the value defaults to 1. If you are entering a service line item, you can enter a number of hours here and a corresponding hourly cost in the Unit Cost field. You can also leave this field and the Unit Cost field blank, and enter a lump sum amount in the Line Cost field. This is a required field, unless you enter a lump sum cost for a service line item in the Line Cost field.

pcardtype.title: Procurement Card Type
pcardtype.remarks: Procurement Card Type Crosses over from MRLINE.PCARDTYPE or PRLINE.PCARDTYPE

receiptreqd.title: Receipt Required
receiptreqd.remarks: Specifies whether a receipt is required for invoice matching on this item. If the check box is selected, a three-way match of purchase order, receipt, and invoice is required. If the check box is cleared, no receipt match is required.

receipttolqty.title: Receipt Tolerance Quantity
receipttolqty.remarks: The quantity of items that can be received over the amount set in the initial agreement.

receivedunitcost.title: Received Unit Cost
receivedunitcost.remarks: Actual unit cost of the received line item.

pelpolinenum.title: PO Line Number
pelpolinenum.remarks: Line Number on the Purchase Order for this material

pelupliftcost.title: SubCon Uplift Value
pelupliftcost.remarks: The Uplift Value being requested by the SubCon Vendor

pelhireoffreturntype.title: Hiring Type
pelhireoffreturntype.remarks: The type of off hiring (drop off, collected)

pelupliftdesc.title: Uplift Description
pelupliftdesc.remarks: The description of the uplift request

exchangerate.title: Exchange Rate
exchangerate.remarks: Exchange rate at time of PO approval.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: Describes the purchase order. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

currencycode.title: Currency
currencycode.remarks: Identifies the currency the PO is in.

followupdate.title: Follow-up Date
followupdate.remarks: Date that the vendor should be contacted for follow-up information on the purchase order.

vendor.title: Company
vendor.remarks: Identifies the vendor for the item.

shipto.title: Ship To
shipto.remarks: Address code where the order will be shipped.

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Purchase Order Description

pelpcardmerchant.title: P-Card Merchant
pelpcardmerchant.remarks: Merchant against who the P-Card purchase was made

revcomments.title: Revision Comments
revcomments.remarks: Description of the changes to the purchase order.

pelmjporef.title: MiJobs PO Reference
pelmjporef.remarks: PO Reference from MIJOBS received from Create PO Message

revisionnum.title: Revision
revisionnum.remarks: Revision number of the purchase order. Indicates how many times a purchase order has been revised. A purchase order that has not been revised displays 0 for the revision number.

statusdate.title: Status Date
statusdate.remarks: Date and time that the PO status was last changed. The default is the system date and time at the time of the status change.

ponum.title: PO
ponum.remarks: Identifies the purchase order record. This value must be unique for all purchase order records.

requireddate.title: Required Date
requireddate.remarks: Date when the purchase order line items are needed.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: Current status of the purchase order.

parent.title: Parent WO
parent.remarks: Parent of the work order shown in the Work Order field. When this field is blank, the work order in the Work Order field is a top-level work order. To assign a work order to a parent, select Assign to New Parent from the Select Action menu.

estservcost.title: Estimated Service Cost
estservcost.remarks: Total estimated service cost against this work order.

pelappr2.title: Higher Approval for Mandate
pelappr2.remarks: The higher approval person group for mandate approval requests

mtfmgeninboundmsg.title: Inbound Message
mtfmgeninboundmsg.remarks: The Inbound XML message for interface error tracking

pelappr1.title: Lower Approval for Mandate
pelappr1.remarks: The lower approval person group for mandate approval requests

ownergroup.title: Owner Group
ownergroup.remarks: The group currently responsible for the work order.

mtfmdonotsave.title: Do Not Save
mtfmdonotsave.remarks: Do Not Save WO When True

pelwosent.title: Work Order sent to Click
pelwosent.remarks: Work Order has been sent to Click

calcshift.title: Shift
calcshift.remarks: Along with the calculation calendar, sets the business hours that calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Select Value button to choose a shift.

stconoffset.title: Start Constraint Offset
stconoffset.remarks: The amount of time (in hours) to be subtracted from the Target Start date in order to calculate the Start No Earlier Than date of the work record.

pelmandateperson.title: Mandate Change Approver
pelmandateperson.remarks: The customer person who approved the change in mandate value

pelmandaternd.title: Rounding
pelmandaternd.remarks: The rounding applied to a mandate approval request

plusprevnum.title: Agreement Revision Number
plusprevnum.remarks: Revision number of the customer agreement.

mtfmcompliancefail_notes.title: Compliance Failure Notes
mtfmcompliancefail_notes.remarks: Please list reasons why asset has been marked as non-compliant.

pluspcustponum.title: Customer PO Number
pluspcustponum.remarks: Number of the customer purchase order that authorizes this work.

wopriority.title: Priority
wopriority.remarks: Identifies the importance of the work order, from 0-999, where 0 is the lowest priority and 999 is the highest.

fnlconstraint.title: Finish No Later Than
fnlconstraint.remarks: The date that work should be completed by.  Scheduled dates should be before this date.

pluspcustomer.title: Customer
pluspcustomer.remarks: The primary customer for the specified configuration item, asset (if no customer is associated with the configuration item), or location (if no customer is associated with the asset or configuration item). You can change the value in this field.

pmnum.title: PM
pmnum.remarks: Identifies the preventive maintenance record from which the work order was generated.

pluspporeq.title: Customer PO Required
pluspporeq.remarks: Specifies whether the work order requires a customer purchase order. If the check box is selected, the work order requires a PO. The default value is False (check box is empty).

pluspallowquote.title: Quote Allowed for Total Price
pluspallowquote.remarks: Specifies whether the work order to which the price schedule applies, allows price quotes for the total value of work order. If the check box is selected, the work order allows quotes for the total value.

pointnum.title: Measurement Point
pointnum.remarks: The point number on the asset from which the measurement is taken.

pelmandatetol.title: Tolerance
pelmandatetol.remarks: The percentage tolerance used before a mandate approval request is made

plusporigqprice.title: Original Total Quoted Price
plusporigqprice.remarks: Original price quoted for the work order total value.

commodity.title: Service
commodity.remarks: Defines the service for the work order, for example: customer support, painting, print, telecommunications, and welding.

active.title: Active
active.remarks: Boolean flag to indicate if the metadata item is active

parentmetadataid.title: Parent Meta Data ID
parentmetadataid.remarks: Allows a parent to be specified (and a Hierarchy Established)

sortorder.title: Sequence
sortorder.remarks: The sort order for the metadata group

plusptargdeliverydate.title: Target Delivery Date
plusptargdeliverydate.remarks: Target date and time of delivery.

calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.remarks: Calendar to determine shift work is to be done on

pluspquotedprice.title: Total Quoted Price
pluspquotedprice.remarks: Price quoted for the work order total value.

statusdate.title: Status Date
statusdate.remarks: Date the work order status was last changed.

mtfmautoapplyrp.title: Auto-apply Response Plan
mtfmautoapplyrp.remarks: Flag to indicate whether an attemp will be made to automatically apply a Response Plan

pelapptent.title: Appointment Entitlement
pelapptent.remarks: The type of appointment entitlement available

worklog.title: Indicates if work log exists for the assignment.
worklog.remarks: Indicates if work log exists for the assignment.

warrantyexist.title: Warranties Exist
warrantyexist.remarks: Specifies whether any warranties exist for the asset on the work order. If the check box is selected, warranties exist. If the check box is cleared (the default), there are no warranties for the asset.

remarkdesc.title: Remarks
remarkdesc.remarks: A comment about the reported failure.

mtfmdrssucessful.title: DRS Integration Successful
mtfmdrssucessful.remarks: All Assignments Received in DRS Successfully

pluspmaxprice.title: Notify if Price Exceeds
pluspmaxprice.remarks: Maximum price that you can charge for this work.  You must notify customer if the price will exceed this amount.

pelpropmandateprice.title: CMV Estimate
pelpropmandateprice.remarks: The current estimate of the Customer Mandate Value

jpnum.title: Job Plan
jpnum.remarks: Identifies the job plan on the work order. If customers are associated with the job plan, one of them must match the customer on the work order. If there is an association between the job plan and a safety plan when the job plan is used on the asset or location, the safety plan is copied. In addition, a single measurement point is copied if there is an association between the asset on the work order and the point name on the job plan.

mtfmgenwosent.title: Published Through Generic WO Interface
mtfmgenwosent.remarks: This field indicates weather or not the Work Order has been published through the Generic WO Publish Channels

plusptotalpending.title: Total Pending
plusptotalpending.remarks: The value of transactions on this work order that were added to a bill batch but not yet billed to the customer.

comments.title: Comment
comments.remarks: Comment or further information pertaining to the asset, location, or configuration item.

cinum.title: Configuration Item
cinum.remarks: A configuration item that is associated with the work order.

isprimary.title: Is Primary
isprimary.remarks: if the asset is primary asset

workorgid.title: Work Organization
workorgid.remarks: The organization of the work record

sequence.title: Sequence
sequence.remarks: The place of the asset, location, or configuration item in a sequential order. For example, you have a work order to inspect some train cars. The train cars are in sequential order and you must inspect each train car sequentially. You assign a number to each train car according to its place in that sequence.

recordkey.title: Record Key
recordkey.remarks: Record Key for worknum or ticketid

assetnum.title: Asset
assetnum.remarks: An asset that is associated with the work order.

worksiteid.title: Work Site
worksiteid.remarks: The site of the work record

location.title: Location
location.remarks: A location that is associated with the work order.

recordclass.title: Class
recordclass.remarks: Class of the work order or ticket

pluspcustomer.title: Primary Customer
pluspcustomer.remarks: The primary customer for the asset. A primary customer is the customer that is used to find agreements, classifications, classification attributes, SLAs and response plans for an asset. When customers are associated with an asset, the asset must have a primary customer.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: Status of the asset, for example, not ready, operating, or decommissioned.

mtfmsrcno.title: Mtfmsrcno
mtfmsrcno.remarks: To hold original system asset number

description.title: Description
description.remarks: The description of the asset to be included on the bill.

assettype.title: Type
assettype.remarks: The predefined type of this asset.

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Asset Short Description (One Line)

slaapplied.title: SLA Applied
slaapplied.remarks: Specifies whether a Service Level Agreement (SLA) has been applied to the work order. If the check box is cleared (the default), no SLA has been applied. If the check box is selected, an SLA has been applied to the work order. To apply or select an SLA, use the Apply SLA or Select/Deselect SLA action from the Select Action menu.

peldependdesc.title: Dependency description
peldependdesc.remarks: A description of the dependency between JobPlans

peldependtype.title: Dependency Type
peldependtype.remarks: The type of dependency between planned lines

pelinclusiveponum.title: PO Fixed Contract
pelinclusiveponum.remarks: The PO where part of a fixed contract (e.g. annual inclusive)

peldependlag.title: Lead/Lag Dur (Hours)
peldependlag.remarks: The lag duration (in hours) between JobPlans (+ve or -ve)

schedfinish.title: Scheduled Finish
schedfinish.remarks: Date and time the work is scheduled to be completed.

remarkenterdate.title: Remark Date
remarkenterdate.remarks: Date and time the remark for the failure code was entered.

plusptotalbillpr.title: Total Bill Price
plusptotalbillpr.remarks: Total amount billed for the work order and its related activities. The price is adjusted for quote rules, if a quote exists on the work order.

pelcustapprvalue.title: Customer Approved Value
pelcustapprvalue.remarks: The value limit approved by the customer

actstart.title: Actual Start
actstart.remarks: Date and time the actual work begain.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: Describes the work order. To enter or view additional information, click the Long Description button.

pluspquotedpricecc.title: Customer Currency Total Quote Price
pluspquotedpricecc.remarks: The total quote price that is calculated in the customer's currency. To calculate the amount, the customer exchange rate is multiplied by the total quote price on the work order. The total quote price on the work orders is in the base currency of the organization on the work order.

sneconstraint.title: Start No Earlier Than
sneconstraint.remarks: The earliest date at which work should start.  Scheduled dates should be after this date.

plusptotaloutstanding.title: Total Outstanding
plusptotaloutstanding.remarks: The value of billable transactions on this work order that are not yet included in a bill batch.

pelaccessinst.title: Site Access
pelaccessinst.remarks: Site access instructions (e.g. key pickup / ferry)

owner.title: Owner
owner.remarks: The person currently responsible for the work order.

pelupliftstatus.title: Uplift Status
pelupliftstatus.remarks: The status of the uplift request

pelhireoffactualdate.title: Actual Plant Hire Date
pelhireoffactualdate.remarks: The date the plant was actually off hired

pelpo.title: Planned Material Type
pelpo.remarks: Purchase Order on which this direct issue item is ordered

pelhireoffref.title: Hiring Ref Nr
pelhireoffref.remarks: The reference number for off hiring

pelupliftdate.title: Uplift Date
pelupliftdate.remarks: The date the uplift request was made

pelhireoffplanneddate.title: Sched Plant Hire Date
pelhireoffplanneddate.remarks: The planned date to off hire the plant

pelpolinenum.title: PO Line Number
pelpolinenum.remarks: Line Number on the Purchase Order for this material

pelupliftcost.title: SubCon Uplift Value
pelupliftcost.remarks: The Uplift Value being requested by the SubCon Vendor

pelhireoffreturntype.title: Hiring Type
pelhireoffreturntype.remarks: The type of off hiring (drop off, collected)

pelupliftdesc.title: Uplift Description
pelupliftdesc.remarks: The description of the uplift request

pelclickready.title: Click Ready
pelclickready.remarks: Indicates that the work order has been validated and can be sent to Click

pelmandatecont.title: Contingency Percentage
pelmandatecont.remarks: The mandate contingiency percentage applied to an approval request

pluspresponseplan.title: Response Plan
pluspresponseplan.remarks: The last response plan to be applied to this work order. To see a history of additional response plans applied to this work order, use the Show History option in the detail menu.

pluspnextbillmemo.title: Bill Line Memo
pluspnextbillmemo.remarks: Memo or remark which can be entered by the approver to describe the reason to hold or dispute the record.

pluspexceedest.title: Exceeds Estimate By
pluspexceedest.remarks: The amount by which the total bill price exceeds the estimated price.

schedstart.title: Scheduled Start
schedstart.remarks: Date and time the work is scheduled to begin.

location.title: Location
location.remarks: Identifies the work order's location. This is not necessarily the asset's location, however, if an asset is entered, its location will default here

pluspapplypstochild.title: Apply Selected Price Schedule to Child Work Orders
pluspapplypstochild.remarks: Indicates whether the selected price schedule is applied to all child work orders that have the same customer as the selected work orders. The selected price schedule will not be applied to any child work orders that already have a customer agreement applied.

apptrequired.title: Appointment Required
apptrequired.remarks: Indicates if an appointment is required for the work order. Tasks that are created for this work order inherit this value, but can be modified.

mtfmnoncomp_reason.title: Non-Completion Reason Code
mtfmnoncomp_reason.remarks: Reason why Asset or location cannot be completed.

historyflag.title: History
historyflag.remarks: Yes/No field or check box that specifies whether a record is a history record or is currently active. History records are complete, closed, canceled, etc. If a Y is in the History? field or the check box is selected, the record is a history record. On the List tab or the More Search Fields dialog box, you can enter a Y in the History? field to include only history records in the search results. If an N is in the field, Maximo includes only currently active records in the search results. If the field is empty (null), Maximo includes history and active records in the search results.

mtfmdrsid.title: DRS ID
mtfmdrsid.remarks: ID of the Job Created within DRS

pelmandatedate.title: CMV last update
pelmandatedate.remarks: The date that the customer mandate value status was last changed

pmduedate.title: PM Due Date
pmduedate.remarks: From the original Next Due Date of the PM

plusptotalbilled.title: Total Billed
plusptotalbilled.remarks: The amount that was billed to date for this work order.

pelupliftstatus.title: Uplift Status
pelupliftstatus.remarks: The status of the uplift request

pelhireoffactualdate.title: Actual Plant Hire Date
pelhireoffactualdate.remarks: The date the plant was actually off hired

pelpo.title: Planned Material Type
pelpo.remarks: Purchase Order on which this service is ordered

pelhireoffref.title: Hiring Ref Nr
pelhireoffref.remarks: The reference number for off hiring

pelupliftdate.title: Uplift Date
pelupliftdate.remarks: The date the uplift request was made

pelhireoffplanneddate.title: Sched Plant Hire Date
pelhireoffplanneddate.remarks: The planned date to off hire the plant

pelpolinenum.title: PO Line Number
pelpolinenum.remarks: Line Number on the Purchase Order for this service

pelupliftcost.title: SubCon Uplift Value
pelupliftcost.remarks: The Uplift Value being requested by the SubCon Vendor

pelhireoffreturntype.title: Hiring Type
pelhireoffreturntype.remarks: The type of off hiring (drop off, collected)

pelupliftdesc.title: Uplift Description
pelupliftdesc.remarks: The description of the uplift request

mtfmrelwoworktype.title: Related WO Work Type
mtfmrelwoworktype.remarks: Used to search related work order by type on the Advanced Search dialogue

mtfmrelwostatus.title: Related WO Status
mtfmrelwostatus.remarks: Used to search related work orders by status on the Advanced Search dialogue

mtfmconceptwo.title: Created in Concept
mtfmconceptwo.remarks: Non-Peristent value to indicate whether this WO was created by Concept

phone.title: Phone
phone.remarks: The phone number (usually a work site telephone number) associated with the work order. If the Reported By person has a phone number associated with it, that phone number is the default for this field.

mtfmcompliancecomp.title: Compliance Complete
mtfmcompliancecomp.remarks: Work on this Asset has been completed.

pelmandatecustref.title: Customer Reference Mandate
pelmandatecustref.remarks: The customer reference for mandate approvals

targcompdate.title: Target Finish
targcompdate.remarks: Date the work order is targeted to be completed.

origrecordclass.title: Originating Record Class
origrecordclass.remarks: Originating record's class, for example: change, release, incident, problem, or work order.

status.title: Status
status.remarks: Status of the work order, for example, in progress, waiting on material, waiting for approval, completed, or closed.

pelappr1limit.title: Threshold for Second Level Appr
pelappr1limit.remarks: The threshold where the second level of approver is also required

commoditygroup.title: Service Group
commoditygroup.remarks: Defines the service group for the work order, for example: IT, production, facility, or fleet.

problemcode.title: Problem Code
problemcode.remarks: The problem being reported based on the defined Failure Class. This is usually the code in the second level of the failure reporting hierarchy.

reportedby.title: Reported By
reportedby.remarks: Identifies the person reporting the work order.

pellocbuilding.title: Building
pellocbuilding.remarks: The Location ID of the building level ancestor of the SR Location

persongroup.title: Work Group
persongroup.remarks: Identifies the person group responsible for the work. Person groups are set up in the Person Groups application.

pluspunbilledtrans.title: Unbilled Transactions on Work Order
pluspunbilledtrans.remarks: Indicates whether there are transactions on the work order that have not been copied to a bill batch.

onbehalfof.title: On Behalf Of
onbehalfof.remarks: Identifies for whom this work order has been created. For example, if someone did not have access to a computer, another user could create the work order on behalf of that person.

pluspquotetype.title: Quote Type for Total Price
pluspquotetype.remarks: Quote type for total price, for example, Fixed Price or Not to Exceed. Valid values are in the PLUSPQUOTETYPE synonym domain.

pelforcebillable.title: Force Billable
pelforcebillable.remarks: A flag to enable the work order to be forced into a billable state

pluspbillstate.title: Billing State
pluspbillstate.remarks: The state of work order transactions in relation to the billing cycle.

pelbusunit.title: Business Unit
pelbusunit.remarks: This is the Value as per the Metadata table where the Metagroup is set to Business Unit

plusptotalbillprice.title: Bill Price
plusptotalbillprice.remarks: The total price for all billable transactions on the selected work order.

origwoid.title: Originating WO
origwoid.remarks: Trigger field for cross over domain.

plusppricesched.title: Price Schedule
plusppricesched.remarks: Identifies a price schedule associated with the customer agreement.

origrecordid.title: Originating Record
origrecordid.remarks: Identifies the source record that was used to create this record.

pmnextduedate.title: PM Next Due Date
pmnextduedate.remarks: From the next Next Due Date of the PM

mtfmautoapplysla.title: Auto-apply SLA
mtfmautoapplysla.remarks: Flag to indicate whether an attemp will be made to automatically apply a SLA

origtkid.title: Originating Ticket
origtkid.remarks: Trigger field for cross over domain.

changedate.title: Changed Date
changedate.remarks: Date the work order was last modified.

mtfmtmpcompliance_date.title: Temporary Compliance End Date
mtfmtmpcompliance_date.remarks: The date when the temporary compliance is due to expire.

pluspbillapproved.title: Bill Approved Work
pluspbillapproved.remarks: Indicates whether approved transactions on the work order are to  be billed while the work order is still open, rather than after the work order has been completed. You cannot use this option if the price schedule uses included pricing, minimum pricing, or price quotes.

contentuid.title: Internal content unique ID
contentuid.remarks: System internal content uniqueid to identify a long description record. It shouldn't be shown to the final user and it cannot be modified.

country.title: Country
country.remarks: The country of the service address.

latitudey.title: Latitude(Y)
latitudey.remarks: The measurement, in degrees, that the service address is north or south of the equator. Latitude is used with longitude to locate a place on a map. You must specify latitude in decimal degrees.

pelviaaddress.title: En-route Stop
pelviaaddress.remarks: A service address that is used as a 'stop' en-route to this Service Address

city.title: City
city.remarks: The city of the service address.

county.title: County
county.remarks: The county of the service address.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: The description of the service address.

formattedaddress.title: Formatted Address
formattedaddress.remarks: This address is formatted according to the map provider's requirements and is updated when a location is found on the map tab. You can use the formatted address to search for addresses on the map tab.

postalcode.title: Zip/Postal Code
postalcode.remarks: The postal code of the service address.

geocode.title: GEO Code
geocode.remarks: GEO code for calculation of sales tax.

longitudex.title: Longitude(X)
longitudex.remarks: The measurement, in degrees, that the service address is east or west of the prime meridian. Longitude is used with latitude to locate a place on a map. You must specify longitude in decimal degrees.

pelviadesc.title: En-route Stop Description
pelviadesc.remarks: A description of the via address (e.g. Key Pickup, Ferry Terminal)

mtfmvisitresult.title: Visit Result
mtfmvisitresult.remarks: Defines whether the asset/location requires follow-on work.

calccalendar.title: Calendar
calccalendar.remarks: Business days and times used to calculate the Target Contact, Target Response, and Target Resolution dates on a ticket or work order. Click the Detail Menu to select a calendar or go to the Calendars application to create one.

peldeliverytype.title: Delivery Type
peldeliverytype.remarks: The type of work (e.g. Contract is included in an annual PO)

targstartdate.title: Target Start
targstartdate.remarks: Date the work order is targeted to begin. If the work order is generated from a PM, the date is supplied by the PM work order generation process.

mtfmcompliancecomp_date.title: Compliance Completion Date
mtfmcompliancecomp_date.remarks: The date on which the compliance complete flag was set.

reportdate.title: Reported Date
reportdate.remarks: The date and time the work order was reported.

pluspnextbillstat.title: Next Bill Line Status
pluspnextbillstat.remarks: The status which will be set on the bill batch line the next time the work order is added to a customer billing.

pelsendtoclick.title: Send to Click
pelsendtoclick.remarks: Send the work order to Click

pelmandatestatus.title: Mandate Status
pelmandatestatus.remarks: The status of the customer mandate value

onbehalfofname.title: Name
onbehalfofname.remarks: Name of  On Behalf of person

plusporigqtype.title: Original Type of Total Quoted Price
plusporigqtype.remarks: Quote type for total price, for example, Fixed Price or Not to Exceed. Valid values are in the PLUSPQUOTETYPE synonym domain.

plusptotalbillprcc.title: Customer Currency Total Price
plusptotalbillprcc.remarks: The total price that is calculated in the customer currency. To calculate the amount, the customer exchange rate is multiplied by the total price on the work order. The total price on the work order is in the base currency of the organization on the work order.

apptrequired.title: Appointment Required
apptrequired.remarks: Indicates if an appointment is required for the assignment.

mtfmmjhhack.title: MiJobs Engineer Acknowledged
mtfmmjhhack.remarks: Job has been Acknowledged on the Hand Help Deice by the Engineer.

mtfmmjlog.title: MiJobs Log
mtfmmjlog.remarks: Rolling log of MiJob Create / Revoke Requests and Status.

mtfmdrsstatus.title: DRS Status
mtfmdrsstatus.remarks: Status of the Job Creation within DRS

craft.title: Craft
craft.remarks: Craft needed to meet this requirement.

scheduledate.title: Scheduled Start
scheduledate.remarks: Scheduled start date and time for this assignment.

appointment.title: Appointment Made
appointment.remarks: Indicates if an appointment has been scheduled.

mtfmdrsid.title: DRS ID
mtfmdrsid.remarks: ID of the Job Created within DRS

startdate.title: Start Date
startdate.remarks: The datetime someone was assigned to start this requirement

pelapptstart.title: Appointment Start
pelapptstart.remarks: The start of the appointment window

mtfmmjhhconf.title: MiJob Handheld Confirmation
mtfmmjhhconf.remarks: Job has Reached an Engineers Hand Held Device.

pelapptfinish.title: Appointment Finish
pelapptfinish.remarks: The finish of the appointment window

workzone.title: Work Zone
workzone.remarks: Indicates the assignment requires resource in this work zone

pelfollowuptype.title: Follow On Type
pelfollowuptype.remarks: The type of follow on works if required (Remedial / Corrective)

taskid.title: Task
taskid.remarks: Identifies the task for the assignment.

workdate.title: Work Date
workdate.remarks: The day that labor availability was calculated for. This date can be different from the assignment dates if the shift crosses midnight.

pelsendtomj.title: Send to MiJobs
pelsendtomj.remarks: Flag to control recurrence on WAITASGN

laborhrs.title: Hours
laborhrs.remarks: Length of time the craft is required.

wplaborid.title: WP Labor ID
wplaborid.remarks: ID to identify the EXACT WPLABOR record used to generate this row.

mtfmsenttojm8.title: Sent to JM8
mtfmsenttojm8.remarks: Has the Record been sent to JM8

mtfmmjsentdate.title: MiJobs Sent Date
mtfmmjsentdate.remarks: Date Assignment Record was sent to MiJobs.

skilllevel.title: Skill Level
skilllevel.remarks: Skill level assigned to the craft.

pelmijobdepdesc.title: Dependent Assignment
pelmijobdepdesc.remarks: A description where dependencies are required on the subsequent assignment

vendor.title: Vendor
vendor.remarks: Vendor associated with this assigned labor.

pelinitialsent.title: Initial Sent
pelinitialsent.remarks: Assignment has been received by Click

pelrequiredengineer.title: RequiredEngineer
pelrequiredengineer.remarks: If checked converts the preferred engineer to a required engineer

pelstartstatus.title: Start Status
pelstartstatus.remarks: Indicates if the assignment is being started for a second time, 1 indicates it is

pelmijobaltcraft.title: Craft
pelmijobaltcraft.remarks: The craft required on the subsequent assignment

mtfmmjconf.title: Confirmed in MiJobs
mtfmmjconf.remarks: Record has been received and a user created in MiJob

finishdate.title: Scheduled Finish
finishdate.remarks: The datetime someone was assigned to finish this requirement

mtfmsenttomj.title: Sent to MiJobs
mtfmsenttomj.remarks: Indicated weather an Assignment create request has been sent to MiJob for this Labor Record

pelmijobaltskill.title: Craft Skill
pelmijobaltskill.remarks: The skill required on the subsequent assignment

pelownersystem.title: Owner System
pelownersystem.remarks: System that currently owns (controls) the assignment

pelpreviousengineer.title: Previous Engineer
pelpreviousengineer.remarks: When an assignment has been re-assigned the labour code for the engineer previously assigned

pelmijobaddeng.title: Multiple Eng Required
pelmijobaddeng.remarks: Flag to show if multiple engineers are required on the subsequent assignment

worklog.title: WORKLOG
worklog.remarks: Indicates if work log exists for the assignment.

parentassignid.title: Parent Assignment ID
parentassignid.remarks: The AssignmentID of the assignment this assignment was split off from.

worktype.title: Work Type
worktype.remarks: Identifies the work order's type. Some example types are: preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, emergency maintenace, capital project, and event report.

glaccount.title: GL Account
glaccount.remarks: General ledger account code to which work order costs are charged. The GL account consists of up to four components: cost center, activity, resource, and element, each separated by a hyphen. If the work order was generated from a PM, Maximo copies the GL account from the PM. This field is read-only if the Charge to Store? check box is selected.

mtfmcompliancestatus.title: Compliance Status
mtfmcompliancestatus.remarks: Current compliance status for this asset.

mtfmlimitbinno.title: Use Pre-defined Bins
mtfmlimitbinno.remarks: Flag to enforce limiting bin number creation

pluspcustomer.title: Primary Customer
pluspcustomer.remarks: The primary customer for the location. A primary customer is the customer that is used to find agreements, classifications, classification attributes, SLAs and response plans for a location. When customers are associated with a configuration item, the configuration item must have a primary customer.

description.title: Description
description.remarks: The description of the location to be charged for this item.

description_longdescription.title: Details
description_longdescription.remarks: Long Description for Asset Short Description (One Line)

pelloccriticality.title: Criticality Rating
pelloccriticality.remarks: The criticality rating of the Location

statusdate.title: Status Date
statusdate.remarks: Date the Locations status was last changed.

actfinish.title: Actual Finish
actfinish.remarks: Date and time the actual work was completed.

location.title: Location
location.remarks: Identifies the ticket's location. This is not necessarily the asset's location, however, if an asset is entered, its location will default here. If the service request is for a location, enter its identifier in the Location field or click the Detail Menu button to select an option and retrieve a value. The Select Value dialog box, by default, displays all locations where the person ID in the Affected Person field is associated with a location record either as location user or as a location custodian. If the Asset Site field contains a value before you use the Select Value dialog box, the list of locations is always filtered by that value. After you select a location, Maximo copies it to the Location field. If the selected location has only a single asset associated with it, Maximo enters its identifier in the Asset field. You can enter related assets and/or locations in the Related Assets table window. NOTE: These options may not be available to all users.
